Title:
Phylogeny of Chaetosphaeria and its anamorphs based on
morphological and molecular data.
Abstract:
The morphology-based classification system of the
lignicolous, pyrenomycetous genus Chaetosphaeria (Chaetosphaeriaceae,
Sordariales) is compared with results from analyses of molecular data.
The taxonomic value of individual characters manifested by teleomorphs
and conidial anamorphs is discussed. In order to reveal the most
reliable data set and more fully elucidate the phylogenetic
relationships of Chaetosphaeria and its anamorphs, we sequenced a
portion of the large nuclear rDNA (LSU rDNA) and the complete ITS region
(ITS1, the 5.8S rDNA gene and ITS2) of 23 taxa that represent 8 anamorph
genera of Chaetosphaeria and 2 other sexual taxa: Striatosphaeria and
Porosphaerella. Four phylogenetic analyses were performed, each based on
different data sets. The phylogenies inferred from both ITS and LSU rDNA
sequence data showed four main subgroups within the monophyletic
Chaetosphaeriaceae. These subgroups correspond to certain morphology of
anamorphs and teleomorphs and serve as a background to distinguish
Chaetosphaeria species into 2, respectively 4 natural groups of taxa.
The 2 sexual and 2 related asexual species currently referred to
Chaetosphaeria grouped with taxa of the Hypocreales. The similarity of
characters displayed by these species with the true species of
Chaetosphaeria is discussed.
